subject: PHAL: add phal-export-devtree app
commitMessage:
PHAL: add phal-export-devtree app

d-bus signal based watch app for software path interface add.

This implements methods for watching for software path
interface add signal and call appropriate function to
initiate phal devtree attribute data collection and save
to preserve partition.
Rules:
  - Watch for interfaces added for the software path
  - If interface added is “Activation”
  - if Activation property value is “Ready”
  - Then software update is going to start
  - Collect phal devtree required attribute list and
    save to pre-defined location

This commit enables the d-bus app only.

Tested : verified manually the signals by forcing
         code update.
Jul 30 14:27:35 xxx phal-export-devtree[2624]: Software path
                    interface add signal received

Signed-off-by: Jayanth Othayoth <ojayanth@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ia1b7a87ef5a64e3c51c8dfa2d2e4ccef34a3e934

spelling
Ack

Hmm, should we wait for the priority to be set (i.e. the real code update to start)? I guess it doesn't hurt anything to synchronize multiple times. Any concern that a user uploads an image, waits a few days, and then activates it? What if some DTB changes occur in those 2 days, sounds like we will not re-synch when they move priority to 0 to start code update?

The reason for keying off Ready state instead of Priority change is that the Priority is set at the end of the update right before reboot so it may not give enough time for this application to do any actions before the BMC is automatically rebooted. In addition, the Redfish API issues an Upload/Activate in one, there's not a separate Upload-only interface (only through the openbmc REST api), and therefore we can assume that most times (if not all) an upload means an activation will follow after it.

Please provide a little more info no testing. Verified device tree was synched? Any concerns with code update finishing (and rebooting BMC) before you can synch the file? Verify that if only the image is uploaded, but not activated, nothing happens?

> will update only when apply guard record in next boot of the host

Just only guard then this is correct - and I guess, we don't have runtime deconfiguration (without guard) use case in rainier (p10).

So, IMO, no device tree update.

HWAS_STATE will update if there is functional state change. if there is guard record at runtime , the chnage in the hwas state is going to refelct in next Host reboot only , runtim BMC reboot no impact.
